title: (x) very thin sans "SH2007" - Kravitz Thermal {Rainer}
content:
Would anyone possibly know what thin font is featured in the attachment? If not, could you recommend any thin fonts like it? Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [head.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924034149/http:/typophile.com/files/head_0.gif) | 1.65 KB |

 [‹ (x) similar to Futura but not quite there - metal Futura {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924034149/http:/typophile.com/node/35494 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 30Rock logo wide sans - Akzidenz-Grotesk Ext {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924034149/http:/typophile.com/node/34799 "Go to next forum topic")
author: instereo

comments.content:
I don’t think this is Neue Helvetica thin, because the lobes of the S are unequal. I don’t have an alternative answer yet, but perhaps you found it in Stephen’s list?

- Mike Yanega

I think Mike is right. It surprisingly looks like [Kravitz Thermal](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924034149/http:/www.dafont.com/kravitz.font?text=SH2007) by Font-a-licious. The S is really disturbing but quite distinctive.
